page.title: 01Description D.Block 04400144
page.content: The D.Block is situated in{Hants.}5 miles east of Andover.Land rises from 61m.(alluvium)in the south east to over 110m.(clay with flints over chalk) to the north and west. Main natural features are the {River Test } and the ancient woodland of {Harewood {Forest.}Chief land utilization is { {arable farming}.Most of the village of {Longparish }and part of {Hurstbourne {Priors }lie in the D Block. { {Longparish }(pop.800+) is picturesque,with thatched cottages and roadside streams, which,together with{ {trout fishing}attracts many visitors.{ {Hurstbourne Priors}(pop.300+)lies on the{River Bourne}between{Andover } and {Whitchurch.}In text,Lparish =Longparish.HPriors =Hurstbourne Priors.
